social_emotional: By 2 months, babies should calm down when spoken to or picked up
By 2 months, babies should look at your face
By 2 months, babies should be happy to see you when you walk up to them
By 2 months, babies should smile when you talk to them or smile at them
language_communication: By 2 months, babies should make sounds other than crying
By 2 months, babies should react to loud sounds
cognitive: By 2 months, babies should watch you as you move
By 2 months, babies should look at a toy for several seconds
movement_physical: By 2 months, babies should hold head up when on tummy
By 2 months, babies should move both arms and both legs
By 2 months, babies should open hands briefly

social_emotional: By 4 months, babies should smile on their own to get your attention
By 4 months, babies should chuckle (not yet a full laugh) when you try to make them laugh
By 4 months, babies should look at you, move, or make sounds to get or keep your attention
language_communication: By 4 months, babies should make sounds like oooo, aahh (cooing)
By 4 months, babies should make sounds back when you talk to him
By 4 months, babies should turn head towards the sound of your voice
cognitive: By 4 months, babies should open their mouth when they see breast or bottle if they are hungry
By 4 months, babies should look at own hands with interest
movement_physical: By 4 months, babies should hold their head steady without support when you are holding them
By 4 months, babies should hold a toy when you put it in their hand
By 4 months, babies should use their arm to swing at toys
By 4 months, babies should bring their hands to mouth
By 4 months, babies should push up onto elbows/forearms when on tummy

social_emotional: By 6 months, babies should know familiar people
By 6 months, babies should like to look at self in a mirror
language_communication: By 6 months, babies should take turns making sounds with you
By 6 months, babies should blow raspberries (stick tongue out and blow)
By 6 months, babies should make squealing noises
cognitive: By 6 months, babies should put things in their mouth to explore them
By 6 months, babies should reach to grab a toy they want
By 6 months, babies should close lips to show they donâ€™t want more food
movement_physical: By 6 months, babies should roll from tummy to back
By 6 months, babies should push up with straight arms when on tummy
By 6 months, babies should lean on hands to support themselves when sitting

social_emotional: By 9 months, babies may be shy, clingy, or fearful around strangers
By 9 months, babies may show several facial expressions, like happy, sad, angry, and surprised
By 9 months, babies should look when you call their name
By 9 months, babies should react when you leave (look, reach for you, or cry)
By 9 months, babies should smile or laugh when you play peek-a-boo
language_communication: By 9 months, babies should make a lot of different sounds like mamamama and bababababa
By 9 months, babies should lift arms up to be picked up
cognitive: By 9 months, babies should look for objects when dropped out of sight (like their spoon or toy)
By 9 months, babies should bang two things together
movement_physical: By 9 months, babies should get to a sitting position by themself
By 9 months, babies should move things from one hand to their other hand
By 9 months, babies should use fingers to rake food towards themself
By 9 months, babies should sit without support

social_emotional: By 12 months, babies should play games with you, like pat-a-cake
language_communication: By 12 months, babies should wave bye-bye
By 12 months, babies should call a parent mama or dada or another special name
By 12 months, babies should understand no (pause briefly or stop when you say it)
cognitive: By 12 months, babies should put something in a container, like a block in a cup
By 12 months, babies should look for things they see you hide, like a toy under a blanket
movement_physical: By 12 months, babies should pull up to stand
By 12 months, babies should walk by holding on to furniture
By 12 months, babies should drink from a cup without a lid, as you hold it
By 12 months, babies should pick things up between their thumb and pointer finger, like small bits of food

breastfed: A newborn baby that is breastfed should be fed every 2 to 3 hours.
A newborn baby that is breastfed should get about 0.5 to 2 ounces per feeding.
A newborn baby that is breastfed should get about 5 to 20 ounces per day.
formula_fed: A newborn baby that is formula fed should be fed every 2 to 3 hours.
A newborn baby that is formula fed should get about 1 to 2 ounces per feeding.
A newborn baby that is formula fed should get about 8 to 24 ounces per day.

breastfed: A 1 month old baby that is breastfed should be fed every 2 to 3 hours.
A 1 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 2 to 4 ounces per feeding.
A 1 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 15 to 30 ounces per day.
formula_fed: A 1 month old baby that is formula fed should be fed every 2 to 3 hours.
A 1 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 2 to 4 ounces per feeding.
A 1 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 18 to 32 ounces per day.

breastfed: A 2 month old baby that is breastfed should be fed every 3 hours.
A 2 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 3 to 5 ounces per feeding.
A 2 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 18 to 30 ounces per day.
formula_fed: A 2 month old baby that is formula fed should be fed every 3 hours.
A 2 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 4 to 6 ounces per feeding.
A 2 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 24 to 32 ounces per day.

breastfed: A 3 to 5 month old baby that is breastfed should be fed every 3 to 4 hours.
A 3 to 5 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 4 to 6 ounces per feeding.
A 3 to 5 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 24 to 32 ounces per day.
formula_fed: A 3 to 5 month old baby that is formula fed should be fed every 3 to 4 hours.
A 3 to 5 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 6 to 7 ounces per feeding.
A 3 to 5 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 30 to 42 ounces per day.

breastfed: A 6 month old baby that is breastfed should be fed every 3 to 4 hours.
A 6 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 4 to 8 ounces per feeding.
A 6 month old baby that is breastfed should get about 20 to 32 ounces per day.
formula_fed: A 6 month old baby that is formula fed should be fed every 3 to 4 hours.
A 6 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 6 to 8 ounces per feeding.
A 6 month old baby that is formula fed should get about 24 to 40 ounces per day.

total_sleep: A newborn baby for the first 6 weeks typically sleeps about 14 to 17 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A newborn baby for the first 6 weeks typically takes 4 to 6 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A newborn baby for the first 6 weeks typically sleeps about 4 to 5 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A newborn baby for the first 6 weeks typically has 45 to 60 minute wake windows.

total_sleep: A newborn baby for weeks 6 to 12 weeks (1.5 to 3 months) typically sleeps about 14 to 16 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A newborn baby for weeks 6 to 12 weeks (1.5 to 3 months) typically takes 4 to 5 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A newborn baby for weeks 6 to 12 weeks (1.5 to 3 months) typically sleeps about 3 to 5 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A newborn baby for weeks 6 to 12 weeks (1.5 to 3 months) typically has 60 to 90 minute wake windows.

total_sleep: A 3 to 4 month old baby typically sleeps about 14 to 15 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A 3 to 4 month old baby typically takes 3 to 4 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A 3 to 4 month old baby typically sleeps about 3 to 4 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A 3 to 4 month old baby typically has 75 to 120 minute wake windows.

total_sleep: A 5 to 6 month old baby typically sleeps about 13 to 15 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A 5 to 6 month old baby typically takes 3 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A 5 to 6 month old baby typically sleeps about 2.5 to 3.5 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A 5 to 6 month old baby typically has 2 to 2.5 hour wake windows.

total_sleep: A 7 to 9 month old baby typically sleeps about 13 to 14 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A 7 to 9 month old baby typically takes 2 to 3 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A 7 to 9 month old baby typically sleeps about 2 to 3 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A 7 to 9 month old baby typically has 2.5 to 3 hour wake windows.

total_sleep: A 10 to 12 month old baby typically sleeps about 13 to 14 hours in a 24-hour period.
naps: A 10 to 12 month old baby typically takes 2 naps per day.
daytime_sleep: A 10 to 12 month old baby typically sleeps 2 to 3 hours during the day.
awake_windows: A 10 to 12 month old baby typically has 3 to 4 hour wake windows.
